page.title: 05The Anglican Shrine
page.content: The{Holy House,}centre of the pilgrimage, was restored in{1931}by{ {Father Alfred Hope Patten,}Vicar of Walsingham. This reminds pilgrims of the home in Nazareth of Jesus Christ, and of Mary his mother and St. Joseph, and is a holy place of prayer. The{ {statue of Our Lady of Walsingham,} (Mary with the Christ Child) is a focal point in the Holy House which itself stands within a larger church. Each pilgrimage includes Mass, processions in the grounds, and prayers for healing and strength from God during{Sprinkling at the Well,} dating from 1061. Many of the 500,000 visitors each year visit the Shrine. Over 7,000 stay in the{Hospice}or in the village and over 7,500 make day pilgrimages from Britain and overseas.
